channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: The lane control approach sign is getting obscured again, 12th November
item.description:
The lane control approach sign from Churchdown towards Elmbridge Court Roundabout (A40 / A417) is getting obscured again by vegetation. Southbound, from Churchdown. Could the greenery be trimmed back again please ? TIA !
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A channel had been dug up across the road & poorly filled in as on the left side of road (travelling towards Cheltenham) it has collapsed & is a danger to car’s wheels., 12th November
item.description:
Travelling towards Cheltenham on the left side of road about 5 metres from the roundabout.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding NOT fixed by remedial work - only marginally less bad, 12th November
item.description:
The drain has not been moved. It is still in the WRONG place. I see the levels have been changed a little. Unfortunately that has NOT fixed the flooding. The water continues to pool at the pedestrian crossing. The pedestrian crossing is STILL used by hundreds of children every school day. The children (as you can see) can either be splashed by passing traffic due to flooding and wade through the MASSIVE puddle or they can move on the cycle path (where the drainage is fine). This WILL led to an accident involving children and bikes. I have been raising this issue for a year. I am NOT going to drop it, so you might as well get you contractors to FIX the problem PROPERLY.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Central Cross Drive, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tarmac collapsing around manhole cover, 12th November
item.description:
The manhole cover on the eastbound side almost opposite the junction with Zura Avenue is becoming raised and sharp edged. The road surface around it has degraded and been eroded away in parts. This will soon become a dangerous, sharp-edged item that cannot be avoided.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beamont Walk, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked gulley., 12th November
item.description:
Drain outside 4 Kings Road is blocked with Road detritus and in heavy rainfall does not clear. Excess water drains from Road down drive and floods garden. It’s happened once this year.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Kings Road, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham

item.title: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles problem, 12th November
item.description:
Temp lights are only allowing 3 vehicles through at a time going into Hucclecote, but appear to be allowing more out of Hucclecote. This is going to cause an issue at rush hour.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles

item.title: Baby carriers and other housing furniture and items been dumped, 12th November
item.description:
These items have been dumped here next to the dumpsters in the narrow lane towards the school for the past two weeks. Obviously intended to be picked up with the weekly rubbish, but this is impossible. Some smaller items have also been stuffed into bins that have been left out and prevents rubbish being properly collected.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Trinity School Lane, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
